content.title: Audioscenic ‚Äî Intern

content.title: Southampton ‚Äî Research Asst.
content.description: Refined ML pipeline for VR scene reconstruction (EdgeNet360). Adapted ML models for 360¬∞ image processing and implemented VR scene rendering in Unity with Steam Audio. Created custom audio recording system for room impulse response and developed acoustic evaluation methods in MATLAB.

content.title: EEE Roadmap
content.description: Open-source learning platform for EEE students with progress tracking across 50+ topics. Built with Astro and interactive graph visualisation (Cytoscape.js) showing topic connections. Features cross-device sync with Google OAuth via Supabase, 43+ unit tests and E2E tests.
content.storyHook: When the degree map lives in a lecturer's head, someone has to build it.
content.challenge: EEE students at Southampton had no clear visual map of how 50+ topics connected across years. Module guides were scattered PDFs. I built the tool I wished I'd had in year one.
content.approach: Interactive graph with Cytoscape.js showing topic dependencies, progress tracking with cross-device sync via Supabase + Google OAuth, shipped as a fast static site with Astro. 43+ unit and E2E tests.
content.outcome: Adopted by coursemates. Open-sourced on GitHub. The project sharpened my instinct for product decisions ‚Äî knowing when a feature is genuinely useful vs. just technically interesting.

content.title: Food Wars (È£üÊàü)
content.description: Cloud-first kitchen inventory app ‚Äî modern alternative to Grocy. Designed Grocy-compatible PostgreSQL schema (40+ fields) with Supabase RLS. Features dual auth, drag-and-drop tables, product image uploads, and a Japanese diner aesthetic.
content.storyHook: Because spreadsheets shouldn't be the future of kitchen management.
content.challenge: Existing kitchen inventory tools are either desktop-only, ugly, or overkill for a shared household. I wanted something that felt like a real product ‚Äî fast, mobile-friendly, and actually pleasant to use.
content.approach: Grocy-compatible PostgreSQL schema with Supabase RLS, drag-and-drop tables, product image uploads, and dual auth. A Japanese diner aesthetic makes the mundane task of tracking groceries feel like a game.
content.outcome: A fully functional inventory app live in production. The project pushed my Next.js 14 and Tailwind CSS 4 knowledge to production quality.

content.title: Portfolio Hall (This!)
content.description: Immersive 3D portfolio website ‚Äî the very castle you're exploring right now! Built interactive 3D museum with Babylon.js, procedural hall generation, collision detection, and three cross-platform control schemes. Features gyroscope camera, minimap, cinematic fly-to, and 2D fallback.
content.storyHook: What if your portfolio was a castle you could walk through?
content.challenge: Most portfolios are read ‚Äî scanned for keywords in 30 seconds. I wanted mine to be experienced: a place where the work itself becomes the environment.
content.approach: Built a 3D castle in the browser with Babylon.js ‚Äî procedural hall generation, spatial audio cues, collision detection, and three control schemes for desktop, mobile, and VR. The 2D fallback (you're in it now) mirrors the castle map.
content.outcome: A portfolio that recruiters remember by name. Every technical decision ‚Äî gyroscope camera, minimap, WebXR ‚Äî became a story in its own right.

content.title: Claude Refresher Orb
content.description: Cross-platform mobile app to track Claude AI usage limits with proactive alarm notifications when the 5-hour rolling window resets. Designed notification system with reset alarms, daily kickstart, and manual countdown timer.

content.title: Home Server
content.description: Personal media and photo management serving a household of 4 with 20TB storage. Deployed containerised apps (Plex, Immich, JellyFin) on Linux with DLNA streaming to VR headsets and various devices.

content.title: PetBot
content.description: Social companion robot with local LLM for privacy-focused users. Integrated Ollama LLM on Raspberry Pi 5, developed Flask server with Socket.IO for real-time communication. Created 3D chassis design and programmed servo/DC motor control. Integrated TTS (Piper) and STT (Vosk).
content.storyHook: A robot that knows your name and doesn't phone home to a server farm.
content.challenge: Smart home devices are either cloud-dependent or expensive. I wanted a companion robot with a real LLM on-device ‚Äî no internet required, no data leaving the house.
content.approach: Integrated Ollama on a Raspberry Pi 5 for local inference, built a Flask + Socket.IO server for real-time control, designed and 3D-printed the chassis, added TTS (Piper) and STT (Vosk) for voice interaction.
content.outcome: PetBot responds to voice, holds conversation, and moves around ‚Äî entirely offline. A proof that consumer hardware is now powerful enough for meaningful AI at the edge.

content.title: AVVR ‚Äî VR Audio-Visual
content.description: VR app reconstructing real scenes with accurate spatial audio. Led technical development across Unity VR, ML pipeline, and evaluation workstreams. Developed real-time spatial audio VR app with Steam Audio, redesigned ML pipeline GUI using PyQt6. Team of 6, scored 84%.
content.storyHook: What would it feel like to stand inside a room you've never set foot in?
content.challenge: Spatial audio in VR is notoriously hard to get right ‚Äî most implementations feel pasted on. Our final-year project aimed to reconstruct real-world scenes with accurate acoustic behaviour.
content.approach: Led a team of 6 across Unity VR, ML pipeline, and acoustic evaluation. Integrated Steam Audio for physics-based reverb, redesigned the ML pipeline GUI with PyQt6, and developed a custom room impulse response recording system.
content.outcome: Scored 84%. Presented to industry judges. The project demonstrated that photorealistic 3D reconstruction and spatial audio can be achieved together on consumer hardware.

content.title: DIY Stereo Camera
content.description: Low-cost stereoscopic camera for 3D video capture with VR viewer. Designed hardware with Raspberry Pi 5 and dual cameras, developed stereo processing pipeline, and created VR 6DOF viewing app in Godot 4.
content.storyHook: Building eyes that see in 3D for under ¬£100.
content.challenge: Commercial 3D cameras cost thousands. I wanted to capture stereoscopic video and view it in VR ‚Äî without spending a month's rent.
content.approach: Designed a Raspberry Pi 5 rig with dual CSI cameras, built a stereo processing pipeline with OpenCV for depth estimation and 3D-180¬∞ video, then created a VR viewing app in Godot 4 with 6DOF playback.
content.outcome: Functional stereoscopic capture and VR viewing on a tight budget. Submitted as my final-year individual project ‚Äî open-source and documented for others to replicate.

content.title: Medical EMG Control
content.description: EMG signal processing for robotic hand control. Developed processing pipeline for finger control, integrated Delsys Trigno sensors with real-time acquisition. Created Random Forest classifier (72% accuracy). Extended with wheelchair integration for assistive robotics. Scored 84%.

content.title: StormMed Smart Meter
content.description: Autonomous smart electricity meter managing renewable power sources for disaster recovery field hospital. Led system integration and ran LabVIEW simulation achieving 71.8% score. Team of 6, scored 71%.
